issues.title: Author Tool Changes
issues.body:
- Didn't see this until now -- need to support initialization tool stop at a certain date
- Rename to Initialization Tool since that is what it is called in description

issues.title: Add check for new authors
issues.body:
How are we checking if authors fetched from pull requests are new or not?

Rather than deleting duplicate authors from array, how about using set? If adding author to set fails, author has already been added, if not, then it is new author. So we can get new authors list and update list of all authors at the same time.

issues.title: Platform dependent commands
issues.body:
When I try to run the code 'gitApi.js', following error is thrown:

_'rm' is not recognized as an internal or external command,_
operable program or batch file.
child_process.js:526
    throw err;
    ^

Error: Command failed: rm -r ./tmp
_'rm' is not recognized as an internal or external command,_
operable program or batch file.

    at checkExecSyncError (child_process.js:483:13)
    at execSync (child_process.js:523:13)
    at C:\Users\shash\WebstormProjects\OODD\ToolRepository\gitApi.js:123:4
    at Request._callback (C:\Users\shash\WebstormProjects\OODD\ToolRepository\gitApi.js:44:4)
    at Request.self.callback (C:\Users\shash\WebstormProjects\OODD\ToolRepository\node_modules\request\request.js:188:22)
    at emitTwo (events.js:106:13)
    at Request.emit (events.js:191:7)
    at Request.<anonymous> (C:\Users\shash\WebstormProjects\OODD\ToolRepository\node_modules\request\request.js:1171:10)
    at emitOne (events.js:96:13)
    at Request.emit (events.js:188:7)


This error is caused due to following line:
		_execSync("rm -r ./tmp");_

There is no 'rm' command in windows. So is this the right way of deleting the folder? Shouldn't we use node libraries rather than platform dependent command to delete the folder?

issues.title: Tools/commands for subsequent steps
issues.body:
Lets put all the important tools/commands which we find here for discussion:

1. API for pull requests: 
curl -i "https://api.github.com/repos/OODD-Mozilla/oodd-project1-sjha5/pulls"

API to get commit list from pull requests:
https://api.github.com/repos/OODD-Mozilla/oodd-project1-sjha5/pulls/1/commits 

2. To get names of author: 
git log --format='%aN' | sort -u

For checking names/email/date of commiter/authors refer to:
https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Basics-Viewing-the-Commit-History
(table 1)

3. For using git from node.js we can use library simple-git:

https://www.npmjs.com/package/simple-git
Description given: A light weight interface for running git commands in any node.js application.

4. For testing:

- Mocha framework (https://mochajs.org/)
- Nock, for mocking (https://www.npmjs.com/package/nock)

issues.title: The callbacks in the test functions are called regardless of the result of tryingToClone
issues.body: The test functions currently do not demonstrate whether cloning was successful or not, because the callback is always executed as soon as the clone operations have begun. It would be better to return the Promise object from tryingToClone and using operations like Promise.all to chain the callback to the successful execution of all of the clone operations.

issues.title: Test case
issues.body:
Interesting comment found in round 1 review 6:
I'm not sure if it matters, but have you tested if the author changes their email in between commits? Perhaps this would be an edge case.
